Name: Develop Educational Offerings
Documentation: The end-to-end process of designing, accrediting, and resourcing academic programs to be offered to students.

Name: Program Design & Approval
Documentation: The strategic process of defining the curriculum, learning outcomes, and academic standards for new or revised educational programs.

Name: Define Curriculum
Documentation: The stage of specifying course content, structure, and pedagogical approach for a program.

Name: Secure Internal Approval
Documentation: The stage of navigating internal academic governance to gain approval for the proposed program.

Name: Gain External Accreditation
Documentation: The stage of obtaining validation from external regulatory and professional bodies.

Name: Resource & Platform Enablement
Documentation: The process of allocating and preparing the necessary faculty, facilities, and systems to deliver a program.

Name: Assign Academic Staff
Documentation: The stage of identifying and allocating qualified faculty and teaching staff to the program.

Name: Prepare Learning Environments
Documentation: The stage of equipping physical and digital learning spaces, including libraries and labs.

Name: Configure Support Systems
Documentation: The stage of setting up administrative and student support systems for the new program.

Name: Develop Research & Innovation Portfolio
Documentation: The end-to-end process of building and maintaining the institutional capacity for world-class research and knowledge creation.

Name: Establish Research Strategy & Infrastructure
Documentation: The strategic process of defining research priorities and building the physical and digital infrastructure to support them.

Name: Define Research Priorities
Documentation: The stage of identifying strategic areas of research focus for the institution.

Name: Develop Core Facilities
Documentation: The stage of building and equipping laboratories, data centers, and other core research infrastructure.

Name: Acquire Foundational IP
Documentation: The stage of securing or developing initial intellectual property that forms the basis for future research.

Name: Build Research Talent & Expertise
Documentation: The process of recruiting, developing, and retaining leading researchers and technical staff.

Name: Recruit Principal Investigators
Documentation: The stage of attracting and hiring world-class faculty to lead research groups.

Name: Develop Research Teams
Documentation: The stage of assembling and training postdoctoral researchers, technicians, and graduate students.

Name: Foster Collaborative Networks
Documentation: The stage of building internal and external partnerships to enhance research capacity.

Name: Deliver Student Education & Experience
Documentation: The end-to-end process of managing the student journey from initial inquiry through to graduation and alumni status.

Name: Recruit & Admit Students
Documentation: The process of attracting, evaluating, and admitting qualified applicants into academic programs.

Name: Market Programs to Prospects
Documentation: The stage of promoting educational offerings to potential students.

Name: Process Student Applications
Documentation: The stage of receiving and evaluating applications for admission.

Name: Offer Admission & Onboard
Documentation: The stage of extending offers of admission and managing the enrollment process for new students.

Name: Deliver Learning & Assessment
Documentation: The core process of providing instruction, guidance, and evaluation to students throughout their program.

Name: Manage Course Enrollment
Documentation: The stage where students select and are registered into specific courses for an academic term.

Name: Provide Instruction & Support
Documentation: The stage of delivering lectures, tutorials, labs, and providing academic advising.

Name: Conduct Assessment & Grading
Documentation: The stage of evaluating student work and recording academic performance.

Name: Manage Student Progression & Completion
Documentation: The process of monitoring student progress, providing support services, and managing graduation.

Name: Monitor Academic Standing
Documentation: The stage of tracking student progress against program requirements.

Name: Provide Pastoral & Career Support
Documentation: The stage of offering non-academic support services, including wellness and career advice.

Name: Certify Graduation & Confer Award
Documentation: The stage of verifying program completion and awarding the degree.

Name: Execute Funded Research Projects
Documentation: The end-to-end process of securing funding for, conducting, and reporting on specific research projects.

Name: Secure Research Funding
Documentation: The process of identifying funding opportunities, preparing proposals, and securing grants or contracts.

Name: Identify Funding Opportunities
Documentation: The stage of searching for and identifying relevant grant calls and research tenders.

Name: Develop & Submit Proposal
Documentation: The stage of writing and submitting a detailed research proposal to a funding body.

Name: Negotiate & Accept Award
Documentation: The stage of finalizing the terms of the grant or contract with the funder.

Name: Conduct Research & Manage Project
Documentation: The core process of executing the planned research activities and managing project resources.

Name: Establish Project Governance
Documentation: The stage of setting up the project plan, budget, and compliance framework.

Name: Execute Research & Collect Data
Documentation: The stage of performing experiments, fieldwork, or other research activities.

Name: Analyze Data & Synthesize Findings
Documentation: The stage of interpreting research data and drawing conclusions.

Name: Disseminate & Report Outcomes
Documentation: The process of sharing research findings with the academic community and reporting back to funders.

Name: Publish Academic Papers
Documentation: The stage of writing and submitting research findings to peer-reviewed journals and conferences.

Name: Manage Research Data
Documentation: The stage of curating, archiving, and sharing research data according to policy.

Name: Report to Funding Body
Documentation: The stage of preparing and submitting progress and final reports to the research funder.

Name: Deliver Societal & Commercial Impact
Documentation: The end-to-end process of translating research and expertise into tangible value for external partners and society.

Name: Identify & Engage Partners
Documentation: The process of identifying potential industry or community partners and developing relationships.

Name: Scan for Commercial Opportunities
Documentation: The stage of assessing research outputs for commercial or societal potential.

Name: Develop External Relationships
Documentation: The stage of building networks and engaging with potential industry and community partners.

Name: Qualify Engagement Leads
Documentation: The stage of evaluating and prioritizing potential partnership opportunities.

Name: Structure & Formalize Engagements
Documentation: The process of negotiating and establishing formal agreements for collaboration, licensing, or service delivery.

Name: Scope Collaborative Project
Documentation: The stage of defining the objectives, deliverables, and terms for a joint project.

Name: Negotiate Licensing & Service Terms
Documentation: The stage of establishing the legal and financial terms for IP licensing or consulting services.

Name: Execute Partnership Agreement
Documentation: The stage of formally signing contracts and agreements.

Name: Deliver & Manage Partner Value
Documentation: The process of delivering on the agreed commitments and managing the ongoing partnership.

Name: Deliver Contracted Services
Documentation: The stage of providing consulting, testing, or other professional services.

Name: Manage IP & Royalty Streams
Documentation: The stage of administering intellectual property licenses and collecting resulting income.

Name: Report on Partnership Impact
Documentation: The stage of tracking and reporting the outcomes and impact of the engagement to stakeholders.

Name: Academic Management
Documentation: The ability to design, deliver, and manage the lifecycle of educational programs and students.

Name: Curriculum & Program Management
Documentation: The ability to design, approve, and maintain the portfolio of academic programs and their curricula.

Name: Curriculum Design
Documentation: The ability to define learning outcomes and structure academic content for courses and programs.

Name: Academic Governance
Documentation: The ability to manage the internal review and approval processes for academic matters.

Name: Accreditation Management
Documentation: The ability to manage relationships and compliance with external accrediting bodies.

Name: Student Lifecycle Management
Documentation: The ability to manage all administrative and support aspects of the student journey from admission to graduation.

Name: Admissions Management
Documentation: The ability to process applications and manage the selection and admission of students.

Name: Enrollment & Records Management
Documentation: The ability to manage student registration, academic records, and progression.

Name: Student Support Management
Documentation: The ability to provide pastoral, academic, and career support services to students.

Name: Academic Delivery Management
Documentation: The ability to plan, resource, and execute the delivery of teaching and assessment.

Name: Academic Resource Planning
Documentation: The ability to schedule courses, assign teaching staff, and allocate learning spaces.

Name: Instructional Delivery
Documentation: The ability to deliver high-quality teaching and academic guidance to students.

Name: Assessment & Grading
Documentation: The ability to design, administer, and record the results of student assessments.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: The ability to strategize, support, and govern the lifecycle of research activities and outputs.

Name: Research Strategy & Development
Documentation: The ability to set research priorities and develop the institutional capacity to achieve them.

Name: Research Portfolio Planning
Documentation: The ability to analyze research strengths and define strategic investment areas.

Name: Research Infrastructure Management
Documentation: The ability to plan, maintain, and provide access to core research facilities and equipment.

Name: Research Ethics & Integrity
Documentation: The ability to ensure all research activities adhere to ethical standards and regulatory requirements.

Name: Research Funding & Project Management
Documentation: The ability to secure and manage funding for research projects from inception to completion.

Name: Proposal & Grant Management
Documentation: The ability to identify funding opportunities and develop competitive grant proposals.

Name: Research Project Execution
Documentation: The ability to plan, execute, and monitor research projects, ensuring delivery on objectives.

Name: Research Financial Administration
Documentation: The ability to manage research project budgets, expenditure, and financial reporting.

Name: Research Output & Impact Management
Documentation: The ability to manage, disseminate, and track the impact of research outputs.

Name: Scholarly Publication Management
Documentation: The ability to support the publication of research in academic journals and conferences.

Name: Research Data Management
Documentation: The ability to curate, store, and provide access to research data in line with policy.

Name: Impact & Dissemination Management
Documentation: The ability to track and report on the broader impact of research and promote its dissemination.

Name: Engagement Management
Documentation: The ability to build and manage relationships with external stakeholders, including funders, industry, and the community.

Name: Stakeholder Relationship Management
Documentation: The ability to develop and maintain strategic relationships with key external partners.

Name: Marketing & Communications
Documentation: The ability to promote the university's brand, programs, and achievements to external audiences.

Name: Partnership Development
Documentation: The ability to identify and cultivate relationships with potential research and commercial partners.

Name: Alumni & Donor Relations
Documentation: The ability to engage graduates and donors to foster philanthropic and community support.

Name: Commercialization & Contract Management
Documentation: The ability to structure and manage commercial agreements, including IP licensing and research contracts.

Name: Opportunity Assessment
Documentation: The ability to evaluate research discoveries for their commercial or societal application potential.

Name: Contract & IP Management
Documentation: The ability to negotiate, execute, and manage legal agreements related to research and commercialization.

Name: Venture Creation & Support
Documentation: The ability to support the formation of spin-out companies based on university IP.

Name: Corporate Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the core enabling and support functions of the university.

Name: Financial Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the university's financial resources, including budgeting, accounting, and procurement.

Name: Budgeting & Financial Planning
Documentation: The ability to develop and manage institutional and departmental budgets.

Name: Financial Transaction Management
Documentation: The ability to process financial transactions, including tuition fees, grant income, and payments.

Name: Procurement & Asset Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the acquisition of goods and services and track physical assets.

Name: Human Resource Management
Documentation: The ability to recruit, develop, and manage the university's workforce.

Name: Talent Acquisition & Onboarding
Documentation: The ability to recruit and hire academic and professional staff.

Name: Payroll & Compensation
Documentation: The ability to manage employee compensation, benefits, and payroll.

Name: Performance & Development
Documentation: The ability to manage employee performance and provide professional development opportunities.

Name: IT & Facilities Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the university's physical and digital infrastructure.

Name: Campus & Facilities Operations
Documentation: The ability to maintain and operate the university's buildings and grounds.

Name: IT Service Management
Documentation: The ability to provide and support core IT services for students and staff.

Name: Enterprise Systems Management
Documentation: The ability to manage and maintain core administrative and academic software systems.

Name: Academic Information
Documentation: Represents all information related to the design, delivery, and administration of educational programs and student learning.

Name: Program Portfolio
Documentation: Represents the structured information defining the university's educational offerings.

Name: Curriculum Specification
Documentation: A detailed description of a program's structure, courses, learning outcomes, and assessment methods.

Name: Academic Policy
Documentation: The set of approved rules and regulations governing academic programs and student progression.

Name: Accreditation Record
Documentation: Official documentation and correspondence related to the accreditation status of programs.

Name: Student Record
Documentation: Represents the comprehensive record of a student's interaction with the university.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: Data submitted by a prospective student for admission to a program.

Name: Academic Transcript
Documentation: The official record of a student's enrollment, courses taken, and grades received.

Name: Student Case File
Documentation: Records of non-academic interactions and support provided to a student.

Name: Research Information
Documentation: Represents all information related to the planning, execution, and output of research activities.

Name: Research Portfolio
Documentation: Represents the structured information defining the university's research activities and capacity.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body detailing a proposed research project.

Name: Research Project Plan
Documentation: A detailed plan for the execution of a funded research project, including budget and timeline.

Name: Ethics Approval Record
Documentation: Documentation of review and approval from a research ethics committee.

Name: Research Output
Documentation: Represents the tangible products and results of research activities.

Name: Scholarly Publication
Documentation: A peer-reviewed article, conference paper, or book chapter.

Name: Research Dataset
Documentation: The curated data collected or generated during a research project.

Name: Intellectual Property Asset
Documentation: A patent, trademark, or other form of protected intellectual property resulting from research.

Name: Stakeholder Information
Documentation: Represents all information related to the university's engagement with external entities.

Name: Stakeholder Profile
Documentation: Represents the master data for an external person or organization.

Name: Partner Profile
Documentation: Information about a corporate, government, or community partner.

Name: Funder Profile
Documentation: Information about a research funding organization.

Name: Alumni & Donor Profile
Documentation: Information about graduates and philanthropic supporters of the university.

Name: Engagement Agreement
Documentation: Represents the formal contracts and agreements with external stakeholders.

Name: Research Agreement
Documentation: A legal contract governing a funded research project or collaboration.

Name: License Agreement
Documentation: A legal contract defining the terms for use of university intellectual property.

Name: Philanthropic Agreement
Documentation: A formal agreement detailing the terms of a donation or gift.

Name: Corporate Information
Documentation: Represents the core administrative and operational data of the university.

Name: Financial Record
Documentation: Represents the financial data of the university.

Name: Budget Record
Documentation: The approved budget for an operational unit or project.

Name: Financial Transaction
Documentation: A record of a single financial event, such as an invoice, payment, or journal entry.

Name: Asset Register
Documentation: A record of the university's physical and intangible assets.

Name: Human Resource Record
Documentation: Represents the data related to the university's employees.

Name: Employee Profile
Documentation: Master data for an employee, including personal details and position.

Name: Employment Contract
Documentation: The legal agreement between the university and an employee.

Name: Payroll Record
Documentation: A record of salary payments and deductions for an employee.
